abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Social Reform Loan
            (PSRL) Project aims to support the medium-term social reform
            program of the Government of Peru. The social reform
            program, will help build the bases for a transparent and
            participatory resource allocation mechanism, rationalization
            of expenditures, decentralized implementation, and
            systematic performance-tracking of social programs. The PSRL
            will be the first of two loans using a Programmatic
            Structural Adjustment Loan instrument. In the short-term,
            the first loan will emphasize safeguarding of critical
            social expenditures especially beneficial to the poor during
            a difficult fiscal adjustment and political transition
            period. In the medium-term, it will also lay the groundwork
            for medium-term reforms, including increasing capacity for
            targeting and monitoring of poverty-alleviation programs,
            launching public access to social expenditure information,
            and unifying health and nutrition programs. A decision about
            whether and when the second operation will depend on the
            progress of the reform program. The reform program proceeds
            to strengthen social control mechanisms, eliminate
            duplication of programs, and increasingly provide incentives
            for decentralization of social services. The Loan supports
            the government's commitment to strengthen
            anti-corruption efforts and to promote the empowerment of
            civil society and the private sector while streamlining the
            public sector's role in an open Peruvian society.
